comments.body: It seems not right to declare module `karma` in `karma-webpack`

I kind of agree that it seems a bit weird, but this is basically an extension of karma, or rather a module plugin and not meant to be imported.  I believe it works, just by existing as a definition within a project's node_modules directory.  It appends two new properties to the Karma options.

I started with the template `dts-gen --dt --name karma-webpack --template module-plugin`, which generates a [similar template](https://github.com/Microsoft/dts-gen/blob/master/templates/module-plugin.d.ts#L2).  It first imports the entire library you are adding to, and then declares a merged module to add new properties to.  This template does not export anything.
